profile:
Safe Homes Canada Home Inspection is a civil-engineering-based home inspection company that has been committed to integrity and excellence for a quarter of a century.
 
In the home inspection industry there is a difference! All of our home and building inspectors are Civil Engineering or Architectural Technology graduates are also members of PHPIC (Professional Home and Property Inspectors of Canada). Our custom-typed reports are driven by and grounded in the vernacular of building sciences and are GUARANTEED.
 
We’re proud to offer the most qualified home inspectors in Ontario and the GTA!After each thorough, top to bottom home inspection we provide you with a custom home inspection report so you have a clear understanding of every point of the home inspection.
 
Forget about checkmarks and confusing builders’ codes…
Unlike many other home inspectors’ reports, a Safe Homes Canada home inspection report is written in common language and includes recommendations on what needs to be done to resolve any issues we find.
 
Don’t risk costly surprises when you buy your next home. Call Safe Homes Canada first!
specialities: A commitment to excellence and integrity for over 25 years.
name: Safe Homes Canada

profile: Many would be resale home buyers are held back by their fear of surprise home repair costs. Others are willing to opt for a less than perfect resale home, as long as they know just what they are getting into. An unstable foundation, faulty wiring, or a roof that will soon require replacement can be extremely expensive repairs. Take away the fear of the unknown and close the deal with Peace of Mind Home Inspections Inc. We help ensure that you can make an informed decision about the largest purchase you may ever make. Credentials: Worked as a licensed renovator for 18 years, worked with a master electrician for 4 years, finished at the top of my class at Durham college to become a certified home inspector, passed all the required courses to become Wood Energy Technical Training certified, have performed thousands of home inspections since incorporating in 1995, I have completed 10,000 hours of classroom and field experience and have earned/acquired the designation of Certified Master Home Inspector. Inspection Process Our inspections take at least three hours, with most of our time being spent on the major components of the house: • Foundation • Heating and Cooling • Plumbing • Electrical • Roof • Windows • Structure • Insulation We are not afraid to get dirty. If it means going into crawl spaces, attics, under decks or on roof tops in order to help potential buyers discover problems, then we do it. We don't just look for symptoms, but also the cause of the problem with the home. Everything we find is detailed in our inspection report. We also encourage that you participate in the inspection with the inspector. It can be an invaluable learning experience. We also perform Industrial and Commercial Inspections, renovation consultations and new home warranty inspections . Our price list is available on our website. Have a look at our blog for home inspection stories and tips. Visit our Facebook page W.E.T.T.Certified We service Midland/Pentatanquishene and surrounding areas, Barrie, Cookstown, Orillia, Elmvale, Tat, Tiny, Vaughan, Victoria Harbor, Wyevale, still servicing Durham Region and Toronto and surrounding areas, but be aware there is a travel and fuel surcharge for areas outside the service areas noted above.
service_area: All across southern Ontario, including Toronto, Durham, Markham, Stouffville, Uxbridge, Clarington, Milton, Kawarthas, Mussellman's Lake, Bowmanville
services:
Pre-listing Inspections, pre-purchase inspections, commercial inspections, investment properties, multiple unit dwelling inspections
Wood Energy Technical Training inspections, renovation consultations, insurance claim inspections
pre offer walk through inspections
specialities: CO testing on heating systems, go into the attics, go on the roof when safe to do so, go into crawl spaces, go under houses, inspect electrical components, plumbing fixtures, test run all units if the appliances come with the sale of the house.
diplomas: Durham College Home Inspection CourseDurham College Apartments in Houses CourseWood Energy Techn
warranty_terms: Conditions observed on the day of the inspection, not liable for hidden or concealed defects.
